name: Edward LIVINGSTON and Gwendolyn Livingston, his wife v. SHORELINE INSURANCE AGENCY, a subsidiary of Rose, Vanderwest, Enders and Kendall, and Commercial Union Insurance Company

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
parties: Edward LIVINGSTON and Gwendolyn Livingston, his wife v. SHORELINE INSURANCE AGENCY, a subsidiary of Rose, Vanderwest, Enders and Kendall, and Commercial Union Insurance Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: John W. Beatty, Knox, McLaughlin, Gornall & Sennett, P.C., Erie, for appellant.
Michael E. Dunlavey, Erie, for Edward & Gwendolyn Livingston.
Gary D. Bax, Erie, for Commercial Union Trust Ins. Co.
casebody.head_matter:
613 A.2d 1203
Edward LIVINGSTON and Gwendolyn Livingston, his wife v. SHORELINE INSURANCE AGENCY, a subsidiary of Rose, Vanderwest, Enders and Kendall, and Commercial Union Insurance Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 24, 1992.
Decided Oct. 14, 1992.
John W. Beatty, Knox, McLaughlin, Gornall & Sennett, P.C., Erie, for appellant.
Michael E. Dunlavey, Erie, for Edward & Gwendolyn Livingston.
Gary D. Bax, Erie, for Commercial Union Trust Ins. Co.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
